text:
From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
 
A guest should not make derogatory remarks about what he is offered by his host but __________ statements.
explanation: The word"derogatory"means expressing a low opinion or showing disrespect. The opposite would be a word that conveys praise or approval.Complimentarymeans expressing praise, which is the direct opposite of "derogatory".

From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.
 
While the refuse dump smelled fetid, the orchard exuded a_______Smell.
explanation: In the given sentence, the underlined word "fetid" describes a refuse dump that has a foul or unpleasant odour. The orchard has a different, more pleasant smell.  The word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to "fetid" and appropriately describes a pleasant smell is "fragrant" which means it has a sweet or pleasing aroma.

explanation: Acomplimentary cardis a card that contains a person's name, job title and contact details, usually given in a professional setting. It serves as a business or visiting card, which is appropriate in this context.

The weather is too hot; I need some water to________ my thirst.
explanation: The word"quench"is the appropriate verb to use with"thirst". The phrase"quench my thirst"is a standard collocation in English, meaning to satisfy or relieve thirst.

explanation: The idiom"neck and neck"is commonly used in competitive situations to describe two or more participants who are very close in performance, progress, or results. It does not necessarily mean that their results are exactly equal but rather that they are very close.

From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
 
The soldiers lay_______the town to arrest the terrorists.
explanation:
The term "lay siege" is an idiomatic expression used to describe the act of surrounding and blockading a town or a building, typically with the intention of capturing or isolating the occupants. When using this phrase, the preposition "to" is commonly used to indicate the target or location of the siege.
Therefore, the correct choice is "The soldiers lay siege to the town to arrest the terrorists."

explanation: The phrase "one another" is used to indicate mutual or reciprocal actions between multiple people or entities. In this context, "one another" means that the team members have a strong bond and care for each other.

From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.
Mary shouldn't have disobeyed the teacher,_________?
explanation: The main statement is "Mary shouldn't have disobeyed the teacher," which is negative because of "shouldn't" (a contraction of "should not"). Therefore, the appropriate question tag to use for agreement is "should she?" This structure seeks agreement or confirmation that Mary indeed should not have disobeyed the teacher.

text:

She wondered if the water was not_________hot for drinking.
explanation: The adverb "too" is used to indicate an excessive degree of something. You make use of "too" as opposed to "very" when the thing goes beyond what is acceptable, needed or comfortable.

explanation: The phrase "between my sister and me" is grammatically correct because "between" is a preposition, and pronouns following prepositions should be in the objective case.

text: In the following options lettered A to D, all the words except one have the same stress pattern. Identify the one with the different stress pattern.

the word that receives the emphatic stress is written in capital letters. From the questions lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer.
 
The man BROUGHT the newspaper.

options.A: Did the woman bring the newspaper?
options.B: Did the man bring a newspaper?
options.C: Did the man bring the magazine?
options.D: Did the man read the newspaper?

explanation:
Emphatic stress is the placement of greater stress on a particular word or syllable in an utterance. This is done for emphasis, clarification or correction. In this case, the response is a correction of a misapprehension made by the person who asked the question. The emphasised word is the word that is corrected in the question. The questioner has made an error in assuming that the man has read the newspaper and the responder is trying to clarify that the man has not read, but bought the newspaper. This is why the word "bought" is emphasised.
Did the man read the newspaper?
No. The man BOUGHT the newspaper.

The president SPOKE to the press yesterday.

options.A: Did the minister speak to the press yesterday?
options.B: Did the president speak to the lecturers yesterday?
options.C: Did the president wave to the press yesterday?

text:
the word that receives the emphatic stress is written in capital letters. From the questions lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer.
 
Comfort prepared a DELICIOUS meal.

options.A: Did Comfort prepare a delicious snack?
options.B: Did Comfort prepare a tasteless meal?
options.C: Did Jummy prepare a delicious meal?
options.D: Did Comfort order a delicious meal?

text:
the word that receives the emphatic stress is written in capital letters. From the questions lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer.
 
OUR Mathematics teacher has been transferred.

options.A: Has their Mathematics teacher been transferred?
options.B: Has our Physics teacher been transferred?
options.C: Has our Mathematics teacher been promoted?
options.D: Has our Mathematics supervisor been transferred?

explanation:
Emphatic stress is the placement of greater stress on a particular word in an utterance. This is done either for emphasis or clarification.In the given sentence, the word "our" is given emphatic stress because the speaker intends to correct an error made in the question asked.
Has their Mathematics teacher been transferred?
No. OUR Mathematics teacher has been transferred.
